abstract: The shift at UBS toward wealth management is driven by a disappointing performance and demands from Swiss regulators to abandon riskier practices like proprietary trading and to buttress its operations with more capital, The New York Times reports.
snippet: The shift at UBS toward wealth management is driven by a disappointing performance and demands from Swiss regulators to abandon riskier practices like proprietary trading and to buttress its operations with more capital, The New York Times reports.
lead_paragraph: The shift at UBS toward wealth management is driven by a disappointing performance and demands from Swiss regulators to abandon riskier practices like proprietary trading and to buttress its operations with more capital, The New York Times reports. Read more »

headline.main: UBS to Shrink Investment Banking Operation
